column3: str
The people of Ishgard are in high spirits, for another heretic has answered for his crimes.

Justice has been done this day, as another trial by combat has concluded. According to one spectator, it was a fight for the ages, as the accused wielded a massive sword and worked his dark arts against his foe. In the end, however, he was no match for his opponent, who ran him through to a chorus of cheers. Seeing no need to afford the man a proper burial, the Temple Knights mean to dispose of the corpse by leaving it in the Brume. Intrigued by the spectator's account, you consider seeking out the knights and seeing this “demon” for yourself.

Kneeling before the body, you spy a crystal, and reach out to claim it. All at once, your body trembles, and a strangely familiar voice echoes in your ears. You collapse, and when you open your eyes, you find the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> standing before you, hale and healthy. <If(PlayerParameter(4))>She<Else/>He</If> calls <If(PlayerParameter(4))>herself<Else/>himself</If> Fray, and it would seem that reports of <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> death were greatly exaggerated. <If(PlayerParameter(4))>She<Else/>He</If> is intrigued when you tell <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>him</If> of the voice you heard, but before you can continue, a cry from the streets below draws your attention. You turn to leave, but Fray bars your path and insists that you discuss the “changes” you are undergoing due to touching <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> crystal.

The freedom to follow your heart─to defend the weak and punish the guilty as you see fit. This is the way of the dark knight, and Fray offers to teach you. You need only accept <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> guidance.
Search for the Temple Knights in the Brume.
Speak with Fray.
So as I was saying, that heretic was fighting like a man <Emphasis>possessed</Emphasis>. Even after he took several wounds, he showed no sign of pain─though there was no mistaking the blood.

As the fight wore on, it began to soak through his armor, spreading to every ilm of his body. But when it began to rise and envelop him as a mist, I realized it wasn't blood, but something dark and twisted...
But the righteous are not so easily cowed, Halone be praised! I screamed myself hoarse when that Temple Knight slipped past his guard and ran him through.
Good riddance, I say. Man was not meant to wield such arts!
Yet I wonder...was he truly one of those...those...

Well, it matters not. I heard the Temple Knights talking of dumping his corpse in the Brume. By sunrise, it'll be stripped bare and tossed over the walls. It will be as though he never was...and as though we never had this conversation.
That's more than far enough for charity. They'll take care of the rest.
...And mayhap sooner rather than later. Come on.
...Is this it? Is this all that awaits?
No... No more. Enough...
Open your eyes. Look. Do you see now? Do you <Emphasis>see</Emphasis>?
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>...<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
(-???-)...I've been waiting for you to open your eyes.
(-???-)You all right? You were moaning in your sleep and sweating buckets besides.
Name's Fray, by the way. And no, I'm not a heretic.
Try convincing a Temple Knight drunk on authority of that, eh? Shame the pompous arse got the better of me.
But how about <Emphasis>you</Emphasis>? You touched it, yes? That couldn't have felt good.
A voice, eh? And a rather distressed one besides...
(-???-)Please, someone─<Emphasis>anyone</Emphasis>!
Not so fast. We need to talk about what's happening to you─what's growing within you, before you get carried away.
There's a darkness within us all─nothing dangerous, mind. In fact, it's quite healthy. But the crystal changes you─gives you the power to channel it.
Do it without proper training, however, and...well...it might hurt.
So go ahead─ask me to teach you. Ask me to instruct you in the ways of the dark knights, and I will.
I know you're still worried about that screaming woman, so I'll keep this brief.
We dark knights don't care one whit for prestige or pedigree. We are free to follow our hearts─to defend the weak and punish the guilty as we see fit.
The law of the land? The authority of a name? These are tools cowards use to escape harm. We have no need of shields figurative or literal.
Here─my blade is your blade, my soul crystal your crystal. Go on, take them. You'll need them soon enough.
